content: sixy helix pi fisher may 31 2023 photo courtesy and copyright of imawale 1 introduction this sock is double-knit meaning there s two layers of fabric and it uses intarsia colourwork intarsia in the round doesn t really work because each intarsia block needs to be worked back and forth rather than always in the same direction the solution is to work in distinct row rather than a typical helix because alternating row are worked in opposite directions you will either have to knit every-other row around the inside similar to melissa b s video https //www youtube com/ watch v=kgu-1qiewts or youwill haveto turnthe sockinside-out aftereachrow as anote afteryouturnthe heel itwill become much more difficult to turn the sock inside out between row so i recommend trying knitting on the inner side materials 3 pairs 6 colours of fingering sock yarn 30g of each yarn for each pair pick two yarns with good constrast us size 1 needles 2 25mm for cuff us size 2 needles 2 75mm for body tapestry needle for finishing optional two stitch markers for the heel optional crochet hook for picking up gusset stitches adjust needles as needed to match the gauge for the body of the sock and drop down a size for the cuff my yarns color a katia united socks -
